pullRequest.body:
Add a few convenient versions of `le_iff_exists_add`.

From LeanAPAP

---

(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

nodes.body:
### PR summary [847d9994ca](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13950/commits/847d9994ca57e908dcf95786cb963103dc1b32be)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ exists_one_le_mul_of_le`
`+ le_iff_exists_one_le_mul`
`+ lt_iff_exists_one_lt_mul`
`- le_iff_exists_nonneg_add`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

> Interestingly, some statements generalise from `ExistsAddOfLE α` to `ExistsAddOfLEOrGE α`, which makes them dualisable.

Can you list these? There are none currently in the PR, right?
I'm not going to copy the entire diff of #11448, so cf #11448. That's where the generalisations happen.
This feels quite baroque to me, and I'm sceptical that such a notion belongs in a basic file.

> This feels quite baroque to me

Sorry, I'm not sure what this comment means concretely for this PR.

I can move the definition to a new file, but then the lemmas I'm generalising should move too, which is a bit weird given that this is supposed to be an in-place generalisation.
I'm saying that I don't believe this is a sufficiently natural notion to live in this file, and you should find a different way to achieve your application!

The only different way I see is the state at the first commit (I'm on my phone so I can't easily check this is actually the first on this PR right now, but if you don't see it I can dig up the reflog) and you can see that it is just a huge load of duplication.

Here's the basic issue distilled in one example: `a <= b -> c <= d -> a • d + b • c <=  a • c + b • d` is true both when `a b : Nat` and when `a b : OrderDual Nat` (and `c d : Real`, say), but there is currently no typeclass encompassing this. And this really is a natural thing to want as `OrderDual Nat` shows up when you try to dualise inequalities.


If that can give a bit more gravitas to this PR, I am currently writing a paper about the general strategy behind generalising inequalities using `smul`.

Update: I meant https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/11448/commits/5cea0b9bd58be4113638510bc58153baefc34cdf

Other update: Seems like Matthew heard your call: #14390

As per https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/144837-PR-reviews/topic/.2313950.20Dualisable.20notion.20of.20ExistsAddOfLE/near/465023218, I have found a way to generalise the rearrangement inequality even further and I do not need this new typeclass anymore. Please review #15813, #15815, #11448 instead!
Actually, I need some lemmas in here, so I would reopen the PR but remove `ExistsAddOfLEOrGE` from the diff
bors merge
This PR was included in a batch that was canceled, it will be automatically retried

Build failed (retrying...):
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10581482731/job/29318871775)

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10581499935/job/29318934859)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10581499935/job/29318933649)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: `ExistsAddOfLE` lemmas
